1.text: These things Jesus spoke, and lifted up his eyes to heaven and said, Father, the hour is come; glorify thy Son, that thy Son may glorify thee;

2.text: as thou hast given him authority over all flesh, that [as to] all that thou hast given to him, he should give them life eternal.

3.text: And this is the eternal life, that they should know thee, the only true God, and Jesus Christ whom thou hast sent.

4.text: I have glorified thee on the earth, I have completed the work which thou gavest me that I should do it;

5.text: and now glorify me, thou Father, along with thyself, with the glory which I had along with thee before the world was.

6.text: I have manifested thy name to the men whom thou gavest me out of the world. They were thine, and thou gavest them me, and they have kept thy word.

7.text: Now they have known that all things that thou hast given me are of thee;

8.text: for the words which thou hast given me I have given them, and they have received [them], and have known truly that I came out from thee, and have believed that thou sentest me.

9.text: I demand concerning them; I do not demand concerning the world, but concerning those whom thou hast given me, for they are thine,

10.text: (and all that is mine is thine, and [all] that is thine mine,) and I am glorified in them.

11.text: And I am no longer in the world, and these are in the world, and I come to thee. Holy Father, keep them in thy name which thou hast given me, that they may be one as we.

12.text: When I was with them I kept them in thy name; those thou hast given me I have guarded, and not one of them has perished, but the son of perdition, that the scripture might be fulfilled.

13.text: And now I come to thee. And these things I speak in the world, that they may have my joy fulfilled in them.

14.text: I have given them thy word, and the world has hated them, because they are not of the world, as I am not of the world.

15.text: I do not demand that thou shouldest take them out of the world, but that thou shouldest keep them out of evil.

16.text: They are not of the world, as I am not of the world.

17.text: Sanctify them by the truth: thy word is truth.

18.text: As thou hast sent me into the world, I also have sent them into the world;

19.text: and I sanctify myself for them, that they also may be sanctified by truth.

20.text: And I do not demand for these only, but also for those who believe on me through their word;

21.text: that they may be all one, as thou, Father, [art] in me, and I in thee, that they also may be one in us, that the world may believe that thou hast sent me.

22.text: And the glory which thou hast given me I have given them, that they may be one, as we are one;

23.text: I in them and thou in me, that they may be perfected into one [and] that the world may know that thou hast sent me, and [that] thou hast loved them as thou hast loved me.

24.text: Father, [as to] those whom thou hast given me, I desire that where I am they also may be with me, that they may behold my glory which thou hast given me, for thou lovedst me before [the] foundation of [the] world.

25.text: Righteous Father,â€”and the world has not known thee, but I have known thee, and these have known that thou hast sent me.

26.text: And I have made known to them thy name, and will make [it] known; that the love with which thou hast loved me may be in them and I in them.
